  "The Library" refers to a covered work governed by this License,
other than an Application or a Combined Work as defined below.

  An "Application" is any work that makes use of an interface provided
by the Library, but which is not otherwise based on the Library.
Defining a subclass of a class defined by the Library is deemed a mode
of using an interface provided by the Library.

  A "Combined Work" is a work produced by combining or linking an
Application with the Library.  The particular version of the Library
with which the Combined Work was made is also called the "Linked
Version".

  The "Minimal Corresponding Source" for a Combined Work means the
Corresponding Source for the Combined Work, excluding any source code
for portions of the Combined Work that, considered in isolation, are
based on the Application, and not on the Linked Version.

  The "Corresponding Application Code" for a Combined Work means the
object code and/or source code for the Application, including any data
and utility programs needed for reproducing the Combined Work from the
Application, but excluding the System Libraries of the Combined Work.

  1. Exception to Section 3 of the GNU GPL.

  You may convey a covered work under sections 3 and 4 of this License
without being bound by section 3 of the GNU GPL.

  2. Conveying Modified Versions.

  If you modify a copy of the Library, and, in your modifications, a
facility refers to a function or data to be supplied by an Application
that uses the facility (other than as an argument passed when the
facility is invoked), then you may convey a copy of the modified

   a) under this License, provided that you make a good faith effort to

   function or data, the facility still operates, and performs
   whatever part of its purpose remains meaningful, or

   b) under the GNU GPL, with none of the additional permissions of

  3. Object Code Incorporating Material from Library Header Files.

  The object code form of an Application may incorporate material from
a header file that is part of the Library.  You may convey such object

   b) Accompany the object code with a copy of the GNU GPL and this license

  4. Combined Works.

  You may convey a Combined Work under terms of your choice that,

portions of the Library contained in the Combined Work and reverse

   e) Provide Installation Information, but only if you would otherwise

   Information in the manner specified by section 6 of the GNU GPL
   for conveying Corresponding Source.)

  You may place library facilities that are a work based on the
Library side by side in a single library together with other library

   a) Accompany the combined library with a copy of the same work based

   b) Give prominent notice with the combined library that part of it
   is a work based on the Library, and explaining where to find the

AsyEOS is distributed under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public Licence version 3 ([LGPLv3](https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/blob/dev/LICENSE)).
Software for the AsyEOS/R3B experiments at GSI/FAIR
Software for the AsyEOS/R3B experiments at GSI/FAIR

The AsyEOS (Asymmetric-matter Equation-Of-State) directory within the [R3BRoot](https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/R3BRoot) framework provides the full detector definitions, Monte Carlo simulation tools, and digitization algorithms for the detectors used in the AsyEOS/R3B (Reactions with Relativistic Radioactive Beams) experimental campaign at the GSI/FAIR (Facility for Antiproton and Ion Research) facility. AsyEOS-R3BRoot, developed on top of the FairRoot framework, is a versatile toolkit for performing Monte Carlo simulations and processing experimental data to measure the flows of neutrons and light charged particles produced in Nucleus-Nucleus collisions in order to investigate symmetry energy of the nuclear equation of state at densities above the saturation one. The AsyEOS software package is a source distribution with recurring releases for macOS and Linux.
Data analysis is included inside the asyeos directory. You can find the subdirectories :
This directory contains all the data TCloneArray structures for the different levels of the detection system.
this allows to get data at mapped level (raw data of each detector).
This directory contains all the classes to analyse the single chimera data and move the raw data into cal and hit data levels.
This directory contains all the online analysis classes to correlate the data collected by the AsyEOS detectors.
This directory contains all the analysis classes to correlate the data collected by the asyeos detectors.
This directory contains some macros for online and offline analysis.

result.name: ASYEOS Release August 2025
result.description:
# Release notes
-Update classes for Chimera ID and energy calibration
-Update github workflow for compilation tests

# Compatibility
- This release has been tested on Debian 11 & 12, Ubuntu 24.04 & 25.04, and Alma9Linux 9.3.
- Fully compatible with FairSoft jan24p1 and jan24p5, both with FairRoot v18.8.2

## What's Changed
* new classes for chimera ID and energy calibration by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/73
* feat(github):Update github workflow by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/75
* Add Paolo's classes and clang-format by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/76


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/compare/apr25...aug25

result.name: ASYEOS Release April 2025
result.description:
# Release notes
-Update classes after experiment

# Compatibility
- This release has been tested on Debian 10, Ubuntu 22.04, Ubuntu 24.04, and Alma9Linux.
- Fully compatible with FairSoft nov22p1 and FairRoot v18.8.0 and v18.8.2, and also with FairSoft jan24p1 and FairRoot v18.8.2

## What's Changed
* Update workflows to debian 11 and 12 by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/43
* Added a new online class for ToFD detector by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/44
* Added functions to set the histogram ranges for ToT by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/45
* online revision by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/46
* Clang-format by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/47
* online revision by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/48
* new ext_h101 for krab and minor revisions by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/49
* Clang-format 15 by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/50
* minor correction in CHIMERA spectra and  CHIMERA+KRAB server activation by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/51
* minor correction in CHIMERA spectra and  CHIMERA+KRAB server activation by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/52
* Added diagnosis histograms for tofd by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/53
* Update tofd online for diagnosis by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/54
* Solved a bug problem with the tofd online by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/55
* Added histograms for diagnosis with timestamps by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/56
* Added LOS for WR differences by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/58
* minor correction in CHIMERA spectra and  CHIMERA+KRAB server activation by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/57
* add new on-line monitor spectrum by @edefilippo in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/59
* Asy revision by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/60
* added new monitor spectra for pedastals by @edefilippo in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/61
* TofD:Changed histogram range to account for 48 paddles by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/62
* new ext h101 for KRAB by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/63
* feat(TofD):Update online by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/64
* TofD:Online update by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/65
* fixed reset of some online spectra by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/66
* changes in CHIMERA online spectra by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/67
* TofD:Update online by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/68
* added online analysis for NeuLAND/CHIMERA/KRAB raw correlations by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/69
* Update R3BAsyTofDOnlineSpectra by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/70
* new online for correlation among dets multiplicities by @p-russotto in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/71
* Update tofd online and clang-format by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/72

## New Contributors
* @p-russotto made their first contribution in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/46

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/compare/jan25...apr25

result.description:
# Release notes

# Compatibility

## What's Changed

* Update zenodo file by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/37
* Moved old folder githubfiles by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/38
* Minor changes in the github workflows by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/39
* Minor changes in the github workflows by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/40
* Clang-format by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/41
* Update readme and zenodo by @jose-luis-rs in https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/pull/42


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/compare/dec24...jan25

result.value: Wang, Yanzhao [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7006-7986] [Universität zu Köln, 50923 Köln, Germany]
Please ask your questions, request features, and report issues by [creating a github issue](https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos/issues/new/choose).

First, you will need to install FairSoft, FairRoot and R3BRoot. For more details:

1. Install [FairSoft](https://github.com/FairRootGroup/FairSoft), required version Nov22p1 or later

2. Install [FairRoot](https://github.com/FairRootGroup/FairRoot), required version 18.2.1 or later

3. Install [R3BRoot](https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/R3BRoot), required version jun24 or later

~~~bash
export SIMPATH=%PATH_TO_FAIRSOFT%
export FAIRROOTPATH=%PATH_TO_FAIRROOT%
git clone https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/R3BRoot.git
cd R3BRoot
git clone https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/macros.git
git clone https://github.com/R3BRootGroup/asyeos.git
cd ..
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ../R3BRoot/
. config.sh
make -j8
~~~
result.original_header: Installation of AsyEOS as part of R3BRoot
